Blade of Baz is the first book from Project Bookworm.
This token gives you a preview of the story.
Mint the full token with audiobook for the rest of the section.
Project Bookworm is releasing one section per epoch from
Blade of Baz, by Jillian Plomin.
Collect the whole book to receive a signed special
edition hard copy when the book is printed, and admission
to our special event at cNFTcon in Las Vegas October 7-9
and Rare Bloom in Denver October 14-15.
Token 19 Preview:
"What’s your name, dear?"
Femi’s heart skipped a beat. She doesn’t even know who I am.
Sun’s alive. My family is safe then.
The Ambassador took an exasperated breath. "Who were you
working with at Brendan’s Way?"
Silence.
"Do you know where the royal impersonator is?"
More silence. Femi’s heart thumped hard in her chest, but she
was determined to stay calm. She would not give anything away.
"Any information about anyone claiming to be, or posing as a
royal can set you free. And you can forget about
this awful place." The Ambassador waited for a response, but
again got none. "Look, girl. I want to make this easy for you.
Surely there are people out there worrying about you.
I can do things to make you tell me—"
"Can you?" Femi cut in. "By the looks of it you can’t do
much of anything right now." Femi gestured to the
Ambassador’s lame foot. "Why are you sneaking down here,
alone, to interrogate me? A bit dangerous, don’t you think?"
In a flash, Femi lunged forward, reaching through the bars.
Her fingers just grazed the Ambassador’s sleeves as she
recoiled reflexively, cringing when she put her full weight on
her injured foot.
"You’re foolish to think I’m alone, girl.|' She turned
to stagger back up the steps. "The offer will expire.
and then you will, too. Consider wisely."

Blade of Baz Preview 19.name: Blade of Baz
Blade of Baz Preview 19.author: Jillian Plomin
Story overview: Ryan and Erica are typical high school students—or so they
think. They have hobbies and homework and friends, and are
generally normal siblings. But one October evening, they
find a curious object that rips them from their cozy suburban
home into a world of rebels, royals, legends, and swords. The
pair now have to find their way back from the strange land of
Aulmagne, but in doing so they ignite chaos and rebellion in
the Aulmagnian people, upsetting the tyrannical rule of
Chancellor Ulrich. Will Ryan and Erica ever make it home,
or are they trapped in this world forever?
